bug.author: mariolovric
bug.summary: TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'str' + solution
bug.description:
Describe the bug There seems to be a bug with certain dataframes (apparently due to index) when doing the profile report. <denchmark-code>--------------------------------------------------------------------------- TypeError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-97-690e6942ecb6> in <module> ----> 1 res = profiler(Xs) 2 res
<ipython-input-56-4b4732a100cb> in profiler(df) 11 def profiler(df): 12 from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport ---> 13 pr_ = ProfileReport(df) 14 desc_ = pr_.get_description() 15 res_ = desc_['variables'][['type','variance','top','freq','correlation','correlation_var']].sort_values('type')
~/anaconda3/envs/env37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/__init__.py in __init__(self, df, **kwargs) 67 68 self.html = to_html(sample, ---> 69 description_set) 70 71 self.description_set = description_set
~/anaconda3/envs/env37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/report.py in to_html(sample, stats_object) 176 else: 177 formatted_values['freqtable'] = freq_table(stats_object['freq'][idx], n_obs, --> 178 templates.template('freq_table'), templates.template('freq_table_row'), 10) 179 formatted_values['firstn_expanded'] = extreme_obs_table(stats_object['freq'][idx], templates.template('freq_table'), templates.template('freq_table_row'), 5, n_obs, ascending = True) 180 formatted_values['lastn_expanded'] = extreme_obs_table(stats_object['freq'][idx], templates.template('freq_table'), templates.template('freq_table_row'), 5, n_obs, ascending = False)
~/anaconda3/envs/env37/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pandas_profiling/report.py in freq_table(freqtable, n, table_template, row_template, max_number_to_print, nb_col) 87 88 if max_number_to_print < len(freqtable): ---> 89 freq_other = sum(freqtable.iloc[max_number_to_print:]) 90 min_freq = freqtable.values[max_number_to_print] 91 else:
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +: 'int' and 'str'
</denchmark-code>
Data: After I have reseted df.index the error didnt appear any more, so the bug is with indices. This was the index: 'BJ110', 'BJ126', 'BJ163', 'BJ054', 'BJ017', 'LP045', 'BJ153', 'AD013', 'NL047', 'BJ036', 'AD026', 'BJ018', 'LP044', 'LP006', 'BO014', 'BJ035', 'BJ155', 'TLL003', 'BJ073', 'BJ068', 'BJ049', 'TLL061', 'NL010', 'AD019', 'LP003', 'BJ107', 'BJ023', 'BJ012', 'TLL067', 'LP020', 'AD031', 'BJ172', 'NL031', 'LP032', 'AD016', 'BJ077', 'BJ047', 'BJ001', 'BJ105', 'BJ062', 'AD022', 'BJ106', 'BJ102', 'BJ022', 'BJ010', 'TLL007', 'AD011', 'LP018', 'TLL004', 'TLL030', 'BJ005', 'AD003', 'BJ025', 'LP005', 'BJ144', 'BJ080', 'TLL062', 'BJ166', 'LP014', 'NL005', 'TLL038', 'BJ072', 'AD032', 'BO001', 'BO024', 'BO005', 'AD004', 'TLL006', 'BJ063', 'BJ007', 'LP007', 'BJ159', 'NL056', 'NL059', 'BJ115', 'NL037', 'BJ003', 'BJ117', 'AD025', 'BJ050', 'LP029', 'BJ149', 'AD002', 'AD010', 'BJ160', 'BJ147', 'BO023', 'NL055', 'NL038', 'BO004', 'BJ123', 'NL051', 'NL011' Code: # profiler function def profiler(df): from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport pr_ = ProfileReport(df) desc_ = pr_.get_description() res_ = desc_['variables'][['type','variance','top','freq','correlation','correlation_var']].sort_values('type') res_['rel_freq%']=res_.freq/len(df)*100 return res_

comments.comment:
The code below does not reproduce the error. Let me know if how this test differs from your situation if the error has not been resolved in the latest version. """ Test for issue 282: https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/issues/282 """ import pandas as pd from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
def test_issue282(): index = ['BJ110', 'BJ126', 'BJ163', 'BJ054', 'BJ017', 'LP045', 'BJ153', 'AD013', 'NL047', 'BJ036', 'AD026', 'BJ018', 'LP044', 'LP006', 'BO014', 'BJ035', 'BJ155', 'TLL003', 'BJ073', 'BJ068', 'BJ049', 'TLL061', 'NL010', 'AD019', 'LP003', 'BJ107', 'BJ023', 'BJ012', 'TLL067', 'LP020', 'AD031', 'BJ172', 'NL031', 'LP032', 'AD016', 'BJ077', 'BJ047', 'BJ001', 'BJ105', 'BJ062', 'AD022', 'BJ106', 'BJ102', 'BJ022', 'BJ010', 'TLL007', 'AD011', 'LP018', 'TLL004', 'TLL030', 'BJ005', 'AD003', 'BJ025', 'LP005', 'BJ144', 'BJ080', 'TLL062', 'BJ166', 'LP014', 'NL005', 'TLL038', 'BJ072', 'AD032', 'BO001', 'BO024', 'BO005', 'AD004', 'TLL006', 'BJ063', 'BJ007', 'LP007', 'BJ159', 'NL056', 'NL059', 'BJ115', 'NL037', 'BJ003', 'BJ117', 'AD025', 'BJ050', 'LP029', 'BJ149', 'AD002', 'AD010', 'BJ160', 'BJ147', 'BO023', 'NL055', 'NL038', 'BO004', 'BJ123', 'NL051', 'NL011']
df = pd.DataFrame(index=index, data={'column_1': ['value'] * len(index), 'column_2': [1.] * len(index)}) report = ProfileReport(df) description = report.get_description() assert type(description) == dict
